caption: b'COVID-19 has challenged us to think outside the box, and through our partnerships in the communities we serve, we were able to do just that. We are delighted to have sponsored Boston Lights: A Lantern Experience at @zoonewengland and share their unwavering commitment to preserving the environment. We hope you enjoyed this social distanced experience as much as we did!\n\nDid you attend Boston Lights? Share your favorite lantern with us!'

b'Though 2020 has been a difficult year, there\xe2\x80\x99s still plenty to be thankful for. We give thanks for our extended National Grid family of colleagues and customers as we continue to meet the year\xe2\x80\x99s challenges together.'

b'You know them as the dedicated folks who take care of your utility and billing inquiries, but did you know our Customer Service team includes a DJ, a choir singer, and an outdoorsman? Check out our Stories to learn more about the friendly faces behind that helpful voice on your phone.'

b"The holiday season may look different this year, but we'll still be keeping spirits merry and bright by sponsoring socially distanced events like the Magic of Lights drive-through experience at Jones Beach, NY. These mesmerizing displays with energy-efficient LED technology are sure to create #MagicalMemories for you and your family \xe2\x80\x94 all from the safety of your car! Head to https://ngrid.com/3pEVKa5 for tickets."

b"During a pandemic that has left many families financially strained, it's more important than ever to fend off phone scammers. Save and share these tips to #StopScams and protect yourself and others."

b"Addressing #climatechange requires everyone to come together to find solutions, which is why we decided to become a Principal Partner for @COP26uk. Click the link in bio to learn about our commitment to tackling one of our world's greatest challenges. #togetherforourplanet #COP26"

b'Unemployment among disadvantaged young people existed before COVID-19, but the economic downturn has seen youth unemployment double. We launched #GridforGood to create employment opportunities in the energy industry for marginalized youth by partnering with local charities in the communities we serve. Click the link in bio to learn more.'

b"Jason Uhlig (on left) knows how to act in an emergency - whether it be combat deployment in Afghanistan & Africa, or in his emergency planning role in our Syracuse office. Through both his careers, he\xe2\x80\x99s helped his country and community through sacrifice. Thank you, Major and all veterans for your service. Learn more of Jason's story: [link in bio] #VeteransDay"

b'You might not see many ghosts and ghouls around your neighborhood this evening due to the pandemic, but fear not! We\xe2\x80\x99ve got the tools you need to fend off the \xe2\x80\x9cenergy vampires\xe2\x80\x9d in your home all year round. #vampireenergy'

b'We love supporting events and organizations in the communities in which we serve - like our long-standing sponsorship of @rwpzoo in Rhode Island! We provided thousands of LED light bulbs to light pumpkins for their socially distanced Jack-O-Lantern Spectacular event. \n\nFunding is vital to help keep these events going, and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support safe, family-friendly experiences during these challenging times.'

b"The investment we make today in our youth will ensure a brighter future for us all. That's why we're committed to providing critical funding for STEM & leadership programs to organizations like @girlsinc of Worcester, Greater Lowell, Lynn & Boston. This investment creates opportunities for girls to step into leadership roles in STEM & beyond like last year's Eureka! Program. #MassSTEMWeek"
b'Turtles move more quickly underwater, but they still couldn\xe2\x80\x99t catch an EV. Learn some quick facts with Boston Lights Trivia in our Stories.'

b'Meet Ryan - Senior Program Manager of our electric transportation programs who\xe2\x80\x99s all about encouraging more people to drive electric in Rhode Island! 

When asked about his hope for a clean energy future, Ryan said: "We only have one planet Earth and I think it's everyone's responsibility to think and act more sustainably, even they are small changes."

Head to the link in our bio to learn more about Ryan's unique career path, why he loves driving an EV, and who he looks up to in the industry.

Tell us, do you drive an EV?

#GreenerGrid'
b'How is a panda like a refrigerator? Find out with Boston Lights trivia in our Stories.'
b'We\xe2\x80\x99re proudly sponsoring Boston Lights at @zoonewengland. Check out our stories to see who\xe2\x80\x99s spreading their wings and taking off toward a #GreenerGrid!'

b"Puerto Rican-born Bostonian & National Grid employee Sandra Alvarado comes from a tight-knit Latino family whose childhood experiences shaped her into the passionate activist and community-builder she is today. She's worked with hundreds of Hispanic families teaching them how to advocate for their children's education as well as trained small & minority-owned businesses on best practices. Sandra's brought this unique experience into her  roles on various teams & organizations, such as the US Grid Modernization Team and the Hispanic Professional Association. \n\nHer Hispanic heritage continues to inspire her to serve those in her community and beyond, as well as makes her a vital and irreplaceable asset to the National Grid team. #HispanicHeritageMonth"

b'We understand that the inconvenience of being without power is especially frustrating during this challenging time, with so many of our customers working from home and children learning remotely. We have thousands of employees and contractors deployed across our footprint continuing to be out there in full force to bring service back as quickly as possible to you.'

b"This week we're celebrating #CustomerServiceWeek. Despite challenging circumstances due to the pandemic, our representatives have risen to the occasion, and continue to deliver solutions for our customers."

b'2020 has been a challenging year that has motivated us all to be better members of our community. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been working behind the scenes on a Responsible Business Charter which outlines the steps we\xe2\x80\x99re taking to create a positive impact for the environment, our economy, employees, and the communities we serve.'
b'Sights to make your heart flutter abound at @zoonewengland \xe2\x80\x98s #BostonLights. Visit for a safe, socially distanced family outing and learn how we\xe2\x80\x99re building a #GreenerGrid.'

b"We're shouting out the National Grid Boston Civic Engagement team for painting the town...blue! This week, they put brush to board and revitalized a mural at Murphy Playground in Jamaica Plain. The project, ongoing into early October, features a fun floral motif and an uplifting quote from civil rights activist Dolores Huerta. With most of us staying local, beautifying the neighborhood is one way to brighten up our days!"

b'This #HungerAction month, many are struggling to feed their families due to the financial impact of COVID-19. We thank @ua3now and @bkborohall for organizing the latest healthy food drive in Brownsville, New York where we distributed over 54,000lbs of food. Visit @feedingamerica to learn how you can also help to make a difference. #GridGivesBack'

b'19 years ago, the 9/11 attacks shook our communities from Brooklyn to Boston and Buffalo. Today, we honor the lives lost that day, the bravery of first responders and everyone affected by the tragedy.'

b"This #HungerActionDay, we're donating $100,000 to help replenish food banks in Massachusetts, New York, and Rhode Island.  The donation to @feedingamerica is part of our ongoing support to our communities, adding to more than $2,000,000 of charitable giving since the pandemic began.\n\n Visit @feedingamerica to learn how you can also help to make a difference."

b'These days, safety kits include masks, gloves & sanitizers - but make sure to also stock your emergency kit for the next hurricane, windstorm, or Nor\xe2\x80\x99easter. Bottled water, first-aid supplies, & batteries can help you stay comfortable in tough situations. #NatlPrepMonth #BeReady'

b'Starting today and running through Labor Day, many of our employees will be raising funds for community charities by participating in a Virtual 5K. Join us as we highlight their efforts and the causes they\xe2\x80\x99re supporting on our Stories.'

b'Today marks the last day of our 2020 Summer Gridtern Program. Although this summer experience was a little different this year, our #Gridterns were able to rise to the occasion! Not only did they help their respective teams, but they also donated a total of 3,000 service hours to their local communities. From all of us at National Grid, thank you!\n\n#GridternsGiveBack'

b'Though they may not have a typical school year ahead of them, we\xe2\x80\x99ve still got local students\xe2\x80\x99 backs. Last week, we continued our annual tradition of donating 200 backpacks to students via @pal_buffalo and an additional 100 to the Enterprise Charter School - each one stocked with school supplies fulfilled through @teachersdeskbuf . #buffalove'

b'The night is finally upon us! We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support Boston Lights: A Lantern Experience. Modifications have been made in accordance with health & safety guidelines. Be sure to bring masks & practice social distancing as you enjoy over 72 acres of lantern displays! For tickets and more information, visit @zoonewengland.'

b'Pandas, tigers, turtles \xe2\x80\x93 oh my! We are thrilled to be sponsoring Boston Lights: A Lantern Experience opening on 8/21 at the @zoonewengland. Learn about the importance of biodiversity while soaking up the dazzling outdoor displays of over 50 lanterns.

During this time of uncertainty and hardship, we are delighted to provide a source of optimism and fun to our MA community.

In order to ensure the safety of staff and guests, Franklin Park Zoo has made modifications in accordance with public guidance & health recommendations. Visit their website for full details on the precautions they are taking & what to expect when you visit. https://ngrid.com/34idtff'

b"Word has it @zoonewengland's building something to brighten up your nights, and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to play a part! Follow us for a behind-the-scenes look and visit\nhttps://zoonewengland.org/engage/boston-lights/\nfor tickets and information on health and safety measures."

b"These days, we can all use a story to make the heart sing :bird:. Take the case of this baby bird, found following a storm that brought down multiple branches in Dudley, MA. With the help of two of our younger community members, line workers Josh and Craig safely returned the bird to its nest, still high up in a tree. It's definitely not our usual service call, but we were glad to help!"
b'Temporarily turn off your pool pump - pool pumps are one of the largest consumers of household energy, second old to the air conditioning unit.'

b'Year-round, we\xe2\x80\x99re working to deliver energy safely and efficiently \xe2\x80\x94 especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. This week we\xe2\x80\x99re talking to employees to share the safety measures they take each day, as well as who they\xe2\x80\x99re keeping safe for. #SafeAndSoundAtWork'

b'Roughly 24 hours after Tropical Storm Isaias hit New England, thrashing the region with heavy rain and winds that toppled entire trees and took down power lines, thousands of employees and contractors continue to focus on clean-up and restoration. As of late Wednesday, we\xe2\x80\x99ve 162,500 in Massachusetts and 97,000 in Rhode Island. However, we realize our work is not done until each customer is back on. In total, more than 2,700 personnel are working throughout our region.'
b'Don\xe2\x80\x99t wait for thunder and lightning to strike, sign up for outage alerts today by texting REG to 64743.'

b'Meet Abdul, a Chemical Engineering major at @stonybrooku and one of our Sustainability Hub interns! Watch how this gamer and gym enthusiast takes us through a day in his life as a virtual intern. #Gridtern #NationalInternDay'

b"Ever wondered what it's like to work as an intern at National Grid? Meet Rebecca, our summer Digital Delivery intern, as she gives us a behind-the-scenes look at a typical workday from home supporting the social media team. #Gridtern #NationalInternDay"

b'Throughout this pandemic, we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen our employees go the extra mile to help their neighbors\xe2\x80\x94and the many communities we serve. From providing PPEs and completing jobs in record time, to feeding hospital staff and EMTs; here are just a few of their stories.'
b'In recent months, reliable service and swift outage restoration have been more important than ever. Here\xe2\x80\x99s to the heroes working safely to keep us connected every day. #ThankALineworker'

b'Our award-winning Woman Engineer of the Year, Cindy Rom, has a strong focus on sustainability and giving back to her local community. In addition to Cindy\'s full-time role with National Grid, she is also teaching future engineers as a professor at New York University.\n\n"Asking questions is a sign of courage, genuine interest, and acknowledgment that you don\xe2\x80\x99t know everything. If you go into a situation thinking you know everything, there\xe2\x80\x99s no room for growth," says Cindy. Read more about her inspiring career path by clicking the link in bio.'

b"Being able to bring your whole self to work is important, whether you're working from home or on-site. While we couldn't celebrate Pride Month in our usual way this year, we continued to celebrate virtually with colleagues in both the US and UK. We also redesigned our Pride Flag to incorporate elements of the Progress Flag, in recognition of the contributions made by Black, Brown and African American LGBTQ+ trailblazers."

b'Nima Kalathil was the first member of her family to pursue a career in engineering. Now, she\xe2\x80\x99s a Lead Engineer in electricity planning and design, supporting our renewable energy projects. Find out more about women in engineering at National Grid: https://ngrid.com/3hV7MZe #INWED2020 #ShapeTheWorld'

b'This week\xe2\x80\x99s Supreme Court ruling is an affirmation of the human rights and dignity of the LGBTQ+ community and furthers our collective endeavor to ensure every employee can bring their whole self to work each day. #PrideMonth #NGPride'

b"As the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic continue to evolve, we're working to ensure the delivery of safe, reliable service. The safety of our customers and employees continues to be our top priority. To learn more, visit http://ngrid.com/covid-19."

b'Recent events remind us that the struggle for equality requires constant vigilance, but also that unity can bring great change. This Pride Month, we honor those who led the way for the advancement of the LGBTQ+ community & we stand with those who promote inclusion today & always. #NGPRIDE :camera_with_flash: @ 2019 World Pride March'
b'Our communities are #PoweringThruTogether thanks to countless local charities and organizations. Learn who we\xe2\x80\x99re working with and how to get involved by watching our Stories.'
b'On Memorial Day, we remember and honor those who gave all to preserve our freedoms.'
b'Across the Northeast, we\xe2\x80\x99re #PoweringThruTogether with local partners and charities. Check out our Stories to see how you can get involved.'

b"We're all spending more time at home, and that means using more energy. But by taking a few small steps, lowering your usage can be easy! Take it from us as we walk you through our favorite energy saving tips."

b'Our local EMS teams face daily challenges on the frontlines battling coronavirus, but it\xe2\x80\x99s not the first time they\xe2\x80\x99ve been challenged, nor will it be the last. We\xe2\x80\x99d like to thank the teams working tirelessly to save lives in our communities. #EMSWeek'
b'Thank you to all our men and women in uniform this #ArmedForcesDay, including the reserves who also wear a National Grid uniform.'

b"Our colleague Kip Morrow shows how community spirit endures through COVID-19 by organizing a free BBQ lunch in his hometown of Portville, NY. 
With Portville having a population of less than 1,000 residents, the pandemic has taken a toll on the small town leaving some residents out of work. Most might look at Portville as just a dot on the map, but to Kip and his family, it\xe2\x80\x99s the best community in the world. This inspired the Morrow family to serve 75 free lunches to local residents at the Sons of American Legion at Post 814, where they plan to hold another lunch in the coming weeks.
And on the side? Hand-sewn masks for frontline workers and the elderly from Kip's daughter Torianne, who dug out an old sewing machine to help her community!

#PoweringThruTogether"

b'While daily life continues to change across the world, we\xe2\x80\x99re continuing to keep the lights on and the gas flowing to homes, hospitals and essential services, while also finding ways \xe2\x80\x93 both big and small \xe2\x80\x93 to support the communities we serve. Find out more: ngrid.com/covid-19'

b'Thank you to our community partners at @unitedwaynyc who\xe2\x80\x99ve connected nearly 300 students with laptops and WiFi during the COVID-19 pandemic and provided more than 14,000 pounds of food to those in need. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support their work, and you can too: https://donate.unitedwaynyc.org/page/content/donate'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s more important than ever to help support small businesses. During the COVID-19 pandemic, we\xe2\x80\x99ve been teaming with local eateries to fuel our local first responders and health professionals on the frontlines. \nOrdering takeout or online goods, buying gift cards and contributing to fundraisers are all ways to show support.\n#SmallBusinessWeek'
b'To the nurses working tirelessly in our communities and around the world - thank you for your service, dedication, and perseverance. #NursesDay'

b'Please know that we are following CDC safety precautions in the wake of COVID-19 as we continue to deliver essential services to our customers and communities. Stay strong and stay safe. #PoweringThruTogether'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s a new course record! Dave Martin was sequestered at our control center for over a month. When he found out he couldn\xe2\x80\x99t run the Boston Marathon, he decided to create his own and raised more than $8k for @tenacityboston. Congrats, Dave!'

b"From a student gym to a 1,000-bed field hospital, our Long Island team upgraded gas service at SUNY Old Westbury to meet medical needs in the wake of COVID-19 in just seven days. 
The Clark Athletic Center was set to become a central hub for healthcare workers, and housing for up to 102 extra beds. To ensure it had adequate heating and ventilation, the gas supply needed to be increased and the meter upgraded. 
Learn more about how the National Grid team, led by Mike Presti, moved quickly to provide overflow capacity for New York's overstretched hospitals in the link in bio. 
#LongIsland #StrongIsland #NewYork #COVID #NationalGrid"

b'For the past few months, these #GridTerns have lived and breathed green energy solutions - now the students have become the teachers. Hear how they\xe2\x80\x99re conserving energy and protecting the environment for #EarthWeek \xe2\x80\x93 you might learn some new tricks! #greenergrid'

b'Each Earth Day, National Grid volunteers have taken to the streets (and parks, schools and gardens) for planting, cleaning and maintenance. While we may be separated this Earth Day, there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot we can do collectively to connect to the world we live in. #GreenerGrid #EarthDay2020\n\nFollow our stories this week for energy-saving tips for your home and ways our employees are commemorating Earth Day.'

b'At National Grid, we pride ourselves on employing hundreds of military personnel and veterans who dedicate their skillsets to delivering energy to our customers every day. A special thank you to two employees, Lisette Lugo and Kyle Metzler, who have been activated by the National Guard to serve and protect our communities. We are inspired by your dedication and selflessness in protecting our country and appreciate all that you are sacrificing to keep us safe.'

b'This week, we lit our landmarks blue to thank all the essential workers who selflessly perform their jobs to keep us healthy and safe during these challenging times.

To the doctors, nurses, delivery drivers, grocery store workers and so many more essential providers \xe2\x80\x93 we stand with you, and we thank you for helping us weather this storm.

We also know that millions of people rely on us to keep the lights on and the gas flowing to homes and critical businesses during these unprecedented times. We\xe2\x80\x99re grateful for our employees who continue to keep our communities going.

#LightItBlue #poweringthrutogether'

b'Southside Hospital in Bay Shore, NY has admitted the highest number of COVID-19 patients out of all the hospitals in Suffolk county. The hospital marked April 14th as a \xe2\x80\x9cDay of Hope\xe2\x80\x9d for its employees, who continue to serve on the front lines of the pandemic. We were thankful for the opportunity to provide lunch to their staff and thank them for the courageous essential services they continue to provide through these challenging times.'

b'A big thank you to the local @girlscouts branch in Syracuse for their generous donation of cookies to our highly-skilled control center operators who have been living on-site for nearly a month. You made our day extra sweet & we appreciate all the good you do for our community!'

b"Finley and Matteo, children of National Grid employee Mike Santoro, showed their support at a distance for their dad who's been sequestered at one of our offices for over two weeks to ensure the safe delivery of natural gas and electricity. We thank him and all of those sacrificing time away from their families to keep us safe. Photo by @kellie3343"

b"To ensure safe and consistent energy delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic, we've sequestered around 200 employees at critical locations across our jurisdictions. We appreciate the sacrifice they and their families are making so that gas and electricity continue to flow to our customers, including hospitals and critical care facilities. We applaud them today and every day. Link in bio for the full story on @cbs6albany."

b"At National Grid, ensuring the health and safety of our employees is our number one priority. We have a comprehensive emergency response plan in place to keep the lights on :light_bulb:and the gas flowing to our customers.

To lessen any financial hardship the COVID-19 pandemic may have on our customers, we have temporarily suspended collections-related activities, including service disconnections across our service territories.

Our pandemic team is meeting daily and we're closely monitoring all developments associated with this evolving and complex virus.

To learn more and stay updated on our efforts, visit the link in bio: ngrid.com/covid-19"

b"Yesterday, we joined forces with @nyrp and the @brooklynnets to give New Yorkers 500 trees as a part of our Threes For Trees program. For every 3-pointer made by a Nets player at @barclayscenter, we\xe2\x80\x99ll plant a tree. So far, we're up to 411 trees! Thanks for coming out! :deciduous_tree: #ThreesForTrees"

b'Patty Orr paved the way for many electrical workers - or should we say ran the lines? Patty was our first female lineworker, following her hiring in 1974. Today, she develops training programs for the next generation of overhead operators. #InternationalWomensDay'

b'We kicked off #WomensHistoryMonth last night with the 3rd annual Women\xe2\x80\x99s Empowerment Game. Our very own Melanie Littlejohn participated in a pre-game panel discussion for women and girls. We thank her and the @longislandnets for the opportunity to help empower the next generation of women leaders! :raising_hands_medium_skin_tone::flexed_biceps_medium_skin_tone:'

b'We were honored to present a check during last night\xe2\x80\x99s @NHLBruins game for the $588,613 raised for charities during our BFIT Challenge last month. We thank all First Responders who participated in the challenge and  raised money for their communities! #GridGivesBack'

b"They keep our energy flowing and continue to push our technology, sustainability, and safety initiatives forward every day. For #NationalEngineersWeek, we\xe2\x80\x99re featuring our engineers on our Stories to see what makes them tick and how they're changing the game."

b'Throughout February, we\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating #BlackHistoryMonth with special events in our office locations with a theme of \xe2\x80\x9cUnleashing the Power of Community, making our Voices Heard\xe2\x80\x9d. Guest speakers throughout the month will touch upon building communities, health and wellness, sustainability and political awareness.'

b"Congratulations to our very own Sean Daly, crew leader for overhead operations, and Ben Williams, project engineer, who won first and second place, respectively, in the 2020 Lineman Life photo competition. This year's photo gallery celebrates linemen across North America who put in long hours in severe weather conditions to keep the lights on :light_bulb:View the top ten submissions on tdworld.com."

b"It's electric! :high_voltage:Our Electric Vehicle team partnered with @thelionelectric and Blue Bird Buses to bring two #EV school buses to the Rhode Island League of Cities and Towns annual conference today in Warwick. Local representatives learned about the many benefits EV buses could offer their towns, such as cost savings and decreased greenhouse gas emissions! #ElectricVehicles"

b'This past Friday, we sponsored Educators Night at Lumagination at @buffalogardens. Be sure to take a walk through the gardens after sundown for an illuminating experience before it closes February 29. #lumagination #buffalove'
location_name: b'Buffalo and Erie County Botanical Gardens'

caption: b'This past weekend, we sponsored the Fourth Annual @nhlbruins BFit challenge, which raised over $500,000 to support the families of fallen First Responders. A heartfelt thanks to all participants, and those who supported this worthy cause! #BFitChallenge'

b"Are we ready for the @NHLBruins BFit Challenge today? Let\xe2\x80\x99s let Blades answer that one\xe2\x80\xa6 good luck to all teams participating in today's event! .
.
.
#Bruins #fitness #nationalgrid"
b"\xe2\x80\x9cLife's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'\xe2\x80\x9d - Martin Luther King Jr."
b'Less than two weeks to go until @NHLBruins BFit challenge. Learn more and sign up here: \nhttps://ngrid.com/2RdHipg'

b'We partnered with @ridecdta to pilot an electric bus program in Albany, NY. New Flyer\xe2\x80\x99s Xcelsior CHARGE buses will eliminate up to 175 tons of greenhouse gas emissions annually, and help the state reach its goal of transitioning to 100% renewable energy by 2040.'
b'From all of us at National Grid, have a happy and safe New Years!'
